definitions.text: the capital raised by a corporation through the issue of shares entitling holders to an ownership interest (equity)
examples: he owns a controlling share of the company's stock

definitions.text: the merchandise that a shop has on hand
examples: they carried a vast inventory of hardware
they stopped selling in exact sizes in order to reduce inventory

definitions.text: the handle of a handgun or the butt end of a rifle or shotgun or part of the support of a machine gun or artillery gun
examples: the rifle had been fitted with a special stock

definitions.text: a certificate documenting the shareholder's ownership in the corporation
examples: the value of his stocks doubled during the past year

definitions.text: a supply of something available for future use
examples: he brought back a large store of Cuban cigars

definitions.text: the descendants of one individual
examples: his entire lineage has been warriors

definitions.text: a special variety of domesticated animals within a species
examples: he experimented on a particular breed of white rats
he created a new strain of sheep

definitions.text: liquid in which meat and vegetables are simmered; used as a basis for e.g. soups or sauces
examples: she made gravy with a base of beef stock

definitions.text: the reputation and popularity a person has
examples: his stock was so high he could have been elected mayor

definitions.text: persistent thickened stem of a herbaceous perennial plant
a plant or stem onto which a graft is made; especially a plant grown specifically to provide the root part of grafted plants
any of several Old World plants cultivated for their brightly colored flowers
any of various ornamental flowering plants of the genus Malcolmia
lumber used in the construction of something
examples: they will cut round stock to 1-inch diameter

definitions.text: the handle end of some implements or tools
examples: he grabbed the cue by the stock

definitions.text: an ornamental white cravat
any animals kept for use or profit
have on hand
examples: Do you carry kerosene heaters?

definitions.text: equip with a stock
examples: stock a rifle

definitions.text: supply with fish
examples: stock a lake

definitions.text: supply with livestock
examples: stock a farm

definitions.text: amass so as to keep for future use or sale or for a particular occasion or use
examples: let's stock coffee as long as prices are low

definitions.text: provide or furnish with a stock of something
examples: stock the larder with meat

definitions.text: put forth and grow sprouts or shoots
examples: the plant sprouted early this year

definitions.text: repeated too often; overfamiliar through overuse
examples: bromidic sermons
his remarks were trite and commonplace
hackneyed phrases
a stock answer
repeating threadbare jokes
parroting some timeworn axiom
the trite metaphor `hard as nails'

definitions.text: routine
examples: a stock answer

definitions.text: regularly and widely used or sold
examples: a standard size
a stock item
